description.narrative: On 5 August 2009 the inter-island ferry Princess Ashika sank off the Tongan coast with an estimated 150 passengers on board. Australian and New Zealand dive teams are continuing to assist in the search for the sunken vessel. The Princess Ashika was recently purchased by the Tongan Government to provide inter-island passenger services following the decommissioning of the existing ferry and prior to the arrival of a new ferry being donated by Japan. Australia offered to provide any necessary temporary support to the Government of Tonga to maintain maritime transport services and to work with regional organisations and national authorities to strengthen maritime safety in the Pacific. Funding under this initiative provides additional contributions to the Princess Ashika tragedy funding of: the Tonga Red Cross and the Counsel to the Royal Commission into the Sinking of the MV Princess Ashika (the Royal Commission); transcription system and services; and chartered flights to sent/bring stud
